response:
The presentation of multifocal CNS deficits (optic nerve and brainstem) in a young female is classic for an inflammatory demyelinating disorder. Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD) is a high priority given the severity of the attack and the presenting 'dry cough', which may represent Area Postrema Syndrome. Multiple Sclerosis is the primary differential. MOG Antibody Disease and other inflammatory or granulomatous conditions are also possible.

differential_diagnosis = ["Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "Multiple Sclerosis (MS)", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD)", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Neuro-Behcet's Disease", "Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis (ADEM)", "Brainstem Glioma"]
